page.title: 04Farming.(3) Barbridge.
page.content: November 12 l985.Milk l750 litres. Frosty, getting out sunny. Cows housed in cubicles now(except 7 dry ones)on self-feed silage eating estimated 35 kg per day.Sold 2 Limousin cross calves at market for Â£140 each and 2 barren cows Â£730 the pair.Bought 2 freshly calved heifers for Â£600 each.Men clearing up road and yard after emptying lagoon yesterday, employed contractor & 4 muck spreaders The Tack sheep came today,100 ewes + 5 rams from Bakewell.30p per week to 1st February,thereafter 90p per week ensuring they go on lst February!Cows milk down 200 litres per day since Monday.Cows outside by day if they wish therefore not eating much silage which could be the trouble-a slightly butyric fermentation.Milk recorder coming tomorrow which will prove those down.
